page.title: 01ABOUT THE AREA
page.content:
This area is in rural{Yorkshire}on the eastern edge of the Pennines.There are two villages,{Constable Burton}and {Finghall}and several small farms. { { }Constable Burton is just off the main{A684}road which runs from Northallerton to Hawes.It is a small village built mainly of stone.
Finghall is also small,and is on the minor road which runs along the ridge of high ground to the south of the area.
The land is steepest to the north and south of the area and slopes in the centre down to Constable Burton beck,which flows eastwards to join the Swale near Bedale about 10 miles away.
